isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: MERITOR WABCO WITH "D" VERSION ECU - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SENSORS

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Removal - Front Axle
svcsubproc.para: To remove the sensor from the front axle:

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving. Apply the parking brakes.

step1.para: Put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving. Apply the parking brake.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over and result in serious personal injury. Always use safety stands.

step1.para: If necessary, raise the front tires off the ground. Put safety stands under the axle.
Disconnect the fasteners that hold the sensor cable to other components.
Disconnect the sensor cable from the chassis harness.
Remove the sensor from the sensor holder. Use a twisting motion if necessary. Do not pull on the cable ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Remove Sensor From Sensor Holder

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Installation - Front Axle
svcsubproc.para: To replace the sensor in the front axle:

step1.para: Connect the sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Install the fasteners used to hold the sensor cable in place.
Apply a Meritor WABCO recommended lubricant to the sensor spring clip and sensor.
Install the sensor spring clip. Make sure the spring clip tabs are on the inboard side of the vehicle.
Push the sensor spring clip into the bushing in the steering knuckle until the clip stops.
Push the sensor completely into the sensor spring clip until it contacts the tooth wheel.
Remove the blocks and safety stands.

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Removal - Rear Axle
svcsubproc.para: To remove the sensor from the rear axle:

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving. Apply the parking brakes.

step1.para: Put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over and result in serious personal injury. Always use safety stands.

step1.para: Raise the rear tire off the ground. Put safety stands under the axle.
Release the parking brake and back off the slack adjuster to release the brake shoes.
Remove the wheel and tire assembly from the axle.
Remove the brake drum.
Remove the sensor from the mounting block in the axle housing. Use a twisting motion if necessary. Do not pull on the cable.
Remove the sensor spring clip from the mounting block.
Disconnect the fasteners that hold the sensor cable and the hose clamp to other components.
Disconnect the sensor cable from the chassis harness.

svcsubproc.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Installation - Rear Axle

step1.para: Apply a Meritor WABCO recommended lubricant to the sensor spring clip and sensor.
Install the sensor spring clip. Make sure the spring clip tabs are on the inboard side of the vehicle.
Push the sensor spring clip into the bushing in the steering knuckle until the clip stops.
Push the sensor completely into the sensor spring clip until it contacts the tooth wheel ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Push Sensor Completely into Clip

step1.para: Insert the sensor cable through the hole in the spider and axle housing flange. Route the cable to the frame rail. Be sure to route the cable in a way that will prevent pinching or chafing and will allow sufficient movement for suspension travel.
Connect the sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Install the fasteners that hold the sensor cable in place.
Install the brake drum on the wheel hub.
Complete the installation. Refer to CTS-5137T in GROUP 14 of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
